text.48_Chapter, 0_Verse, 0_Comment: "To the conductor, listen to this all nations" - this psalm is very important, because it explains the light of the afterlife (lit. World to come) and the undying soul of wisdom.
text.48_Chapter, 3_Verse, 0_Comment: "My mouth" - to teach all the wisdom hidden from them, which those wise of heart explain by riddles.
text.48_Chapter, 9_Verse, 0_Comment: "And he shall live" - that is how he who works to gain treasure thinks
text.129_Chapter, 0_Verse, 0_Comment: Why does it say "from the depth"? Because of the depth of poverty and low status in the diaspora.
text.48_Chapter, 3_Verse, 1_Comment: And "thoughts and insights" - that my heart thought.
text.134_Chapter, 1_Verse, 0_Comment: "Who stand" - those are the priests who perform the sacrifices and those who play the trumpets
text.48_Chapter, 1_Verse, 0_Comment: "Listen" - to the message he gives, that addresses all in whose nostrils G-d (lit. hashem, the name) blew the breath of life. Therefore, "listen all who dwell on Earth".
text.135_Chapter, 2_Verse, 0_Comment: "Thank the Lord of lords" - the angels are the lords of the earth.
text.48_Chapter, 2_Verse, 0_Comment: "Also" - calling the sons of Adam who aren't wealthy, or who are and are well known. That is the reason for also having "sons of man", to include the rich and the poor.
text.135_Chapter, 1_Verse, 0_Comment: "Thank the God of gods" - the God of the high angels, who don't have bodies [and are therefore called gods].
